column3: Common autotools convention is 'make check'.  I don't know that it matters much, but might increase the likelihood of it being run. (But perhaps make test is more popular elsewhere?)\n
ACK either (or both) ways.  autotools does "make check", therefore that is widely spread.  "make test" is also quite common in hand-rolled makefiles.\n
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/3c29fd5dd6c2b34205d5c556797ca3ee37328a6d for binaries and test log.\n
